QAPair.Question: What is (are) Ozena ?
QAPair.Answer: Ozena is a disease of the nose in which the bony ridges and mucous membranes of the nose waste away. Ozena is also called atrophic rhinitis.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Ozena ?
QAPair.Answer: Nasal crusting, discharge, congestion, and a very bad smell are other common symptoms of ozena. Ozena may develop after a long period of nasal swelling.
